intro: Ludwigia foliobracteolata, commonly known as the leaf-bract Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking, often red or orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are usually alternate and may have a distinctive bract-like structure at the base. Ludwigia foliobracteolata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various aquatic environments.
